metadata.title: Seller Discretionary Earnings (SDE) Calculator
metadata.description: Interactive SDE calculator with reconciled add-backs and multiple input workflows. Produces SDE, SDE margin, and reconciled profit figures with guidance and accuracy caveats aligned to recognised instrumentation and security standards.

standard_sde.label: Standard SDE (from Net Income)
standard_sde.description: Compute SDE starting from reported net income and adding back owner-specific compensation, financing, tax, accounting and one-time items to estimate cash flow available to an owner-operator.

sde.expression: net_income + owner_salary + owner_benefits + interest_expense + taxes + depreciation_amortization + nonrecurring_expenses + rent_paid_to_owner + other_adjustments - nonoperating_income
sde.label: Seller's Discretionary Earnings (raw)

addbacks_reconciled.label: Reconciled Net Profit and Add-backs
addbacks_reconciled.description: Reconcile reported net income to a profit figure that excludes non-operating items then apply owner add-backs to estimate normalized SDE.

reconciled_net_profit.label: Reconciled net profit (prior to owner add-backs)

sde_from_reconciled.expression: reconciled_net_profit + owner_salary + owner_benefits + interest_expense + depreciation_amortization + taxes + rent_paid_to_owner
sde_from_reconciled.label: Seller's Discretionary Earnings (reconciled)

from_ebit.label: SDE from EBIT (alternate)
from_ebit.description: Start from EBIT when interest and taxes are already removed from the input set; add owner compensation and nonrecurring adjustments to reach SDE.

sde_from_ebit_var.expression: ebit + owner_salary + owner_benefits + nonrecurring_expenses + other_adjustments + rent_paid_to_owner - nonoperating_income
sde_from_ebit_var.label: SDE estimated from EBIT

fields.label: Owner benefits (insurance, personal vehicle benefit, etc.)
Owner personal expenses paid by the business
Interest expense (add back if owner financing)
Rent paid to owner (add-back if applicable)

introduction: Seller's Discretionary Earnings (SDE) is a commonly used cash-flow proxy for small owner-operated businesses. It starts from reported profit and adds back owner-specific compensation, nonrecurring items, and financing or tax effects that are not required by a new owner.

This calculator offers three workflows: a standard SDE built from net income, a reconciliation-first workflow for careful add-backs, and an alternate path starting from EBIT. Use the workflow that matches your accounts and reconciling documentation.
methodology: Primary formula: SDE = Net income + Owner compensation + Owner benefits + Interest + Taxes + Depreciation & amortization + One-time expenses + Owner rent (if applicable) + Other approved add-backs âˆ’ Non-operating income.
Reconciled workflows separate non-operating and one-time items first, then add owner-specific costs to reduce double-counting and improve comparability across buyers.
Security, data handling, and reporting recommendations follow controls and documentation best practices cited by leading standards bodies to support traceability and auditability of inputs.
how_is_calculated: Step 1: Choose the input workflow that matches your financial statements (Net Income, Reconciled Add-backs, or EBIT).
Step 2: Enter reported figures in the input fields. Provide supporting notes for any nonrecurring or owner-specific items used as add-backs.
Step 3: Review outputs: SDE value and SDE margin. If total revenue is zero or not provided, margin will be zero or not meaningful; rely on SDE absolute value instead.
Step 4: Keep a reconciliation memo and source documents; buyers and professional valuers typically require supporting schedules for add-backs.

faqs.question: Is SDE the same as EBITDA?
faqs.answer: No. EBITDA excludes owner compensation and some owner-specific add-backs. SDE is intended for small owner-operated businesses and typically adds back owner salary and benefits to estimate cash available to an owner-operator.

faqs.question: Which inputs need documentation?
faqs.answer: Nonrecurring expenses, owner personal expenses paid by the business, and unusual adjustments require source documents such as invoices, contracts, or written explanations to be credible to buyers or advisors.

faqs.question: How accurate is this calculator?
faqs.answer: This tool provides an estimation framework. Accuracy depends on the quality of inputs and the completeness of reconciliations. Use this for preliminary analysis and engage a qualified accountant or valuation professional for transaction-level valuation. See accuracy and compliance notes below.

faqs.question: Can I use tax-deductible items as add-backs?
faqs.answer: Only when they are owner-specific or non-operating in nature. Items required for ongoing operations should not be added back. Consult a tax professional for tax treatment implications.

glossary.definition: A cash-flow proxy for small owner-operated businesses that adds owner compensation and other discretionary or nonrecurring items back to reported profit.
An expense that is added back to reported earnings because it is nonrecurring, owner-specific, or non-operational and is not expected to recur for a new owner.
Reported net income adjusted to remove non-operating items and one-time events before applying owner add-backs.
Earnings before interest and taxes; useful as an alternate starting point when interest and taxes are already excluded.
